message: What's a reasonable price to pay for a 1 bedroom apartment downtown?
You'll be lucky to find anything under $2k downtown that's not a dump.
Also, SF doesn't really have a "downtown." So that's open to interpretation. Do you mean Finance District?

With the great transportation, you could easily live in the peninsula, or east bay. You're looking for $1800-$2500 for a simple 1 bedroom in the city. However, depending on where you go, you can get a place for $900-$1400, but this is further outside the city.
Eh that great transportation is getting cutback all the time. It also really takes it's toll. It's not for everyone -- especially people who aren't married.

It also totally depends on where you work (though I know you can't choose based on where you work because work might change). We partly chose to live in Lower Pac Heights because it's easy to go north/south/east/west with transport, but yeah it might be hard to find somewhere under $1800 if you're looking at living alone in this area...
you can get a nice studio from $1000 - $1600
studio apartments are a great option for if you live alone... I mean, what's the point of having more than one room for one person?
Yeah, that's why @ericflo has a separate bedroom too. Otherwise he can't work when me and @anneflo are over
i like to have a clear separation between my bedroom and my living room, so i live in a 1bed
What about short term rentals? A few weeks in June and July - Where's a good place to search be found?

@ghostexecutive some friends & I just got an apartment in June / July from roomarama.com, haven't got there yet, but it seems nice from the site. We also tried AirBnB.com. There's also 9flats.com, but it's more Europe based I think (couldn't find any SF on there)

There's a place in South Beach where you can get a 3,6 month lease for under $2,000/month. That's not too bad considering you'll have a few months to hunt for a cheaper place and get to know the city, or meet potential roommates, before committing to a yearly lease.
Try searching in the outer sunset. I have a nice (1300 sqft) 2 bedroom, 2 bath, with garage and washer/dryer for $1750 a month. Only one block from golden gate park and four blocks from the beach.
@barkerja the outer sunset would be great if public trans there was better
@chadselph True, but the new N-Judah Express has really helped.
@barkerja 1300sqft on the penninsula is HUGE from what I understand.  Most apts are in the 500-800sqft range.
Anyone have an opinion of 2000 Post Apartments in Lower Pac Heights?
Anyone know of a nice studio for rent ?
I would be interested in knowing some average price. 1 bedroom hole in the wall? :)
We found a great 1B in the outer Richmond for $1600. 1 block away from Geary St. 25m to Market St by bus
